text: Shares of capital goods major Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. fell by as much as 3.8 percent to Rs 153.55 after surging 15.6 percent on Wednesday, after brokerages maintained their pessimistic view on the stock. Only J.P. Morgan and Citi hiked price targets, while others including BNP Paribas and Macquarie maintained their bearish view. Five brokerage  firms have a price target of anywhere between Rs 75 and Rs 122 per share on BHEL, suggesting significant downside from current levels of Rs 155.Here’s a snapshot of what analysts had to say on their earnings note:
title: Brokerages Remain Bearish On BHEL’s Future Prospects
